article_node.title: Sinkhole the size of 10p coin forces closure of road
article_node.summary: A small sinkhole in Cowes on the Isle of Wight has caused the closure of a 79-meter stretch of road for over a week due to concerns about a larger void beneath the surface. Local residents have expressed frustration over the prolonged closure, with some questioning the priorities of the highway authority. Repairs are set to begin on August 26, with Southern Water taking over the site to address a broken sewer beneath the road.
